page.title: 06SCHOOLS
page.content: Parklands County High School caters for 13-18 age range of Leeds' 3-tier system of education, others being 5-9 (primary) 9-13 (middle). Parklands is one of 9 single-sex High Schools in Leeds, educating only girls. 650 girls are on roll, the annual intake is over 200. Its location makes it a popular choice among Asian parents who live relatively near, and who choose to have their daughters in single-sex schools. The school, in common with all other Leeds schools, serves primarily its own immediate community, as does nearby Foxwood.This provides for girls and boys, and has a large capacity of almost 1000 children and an annual intake of 360. Both schools present a broad curriculum and offer a full range of courses, including those leading to university careers.
